channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Taliban's religious police instructed to be more moderate, but vulnerable Afghans say brutal justice is still being meted out
Her mother died from an unsafe abortion. She fears other women are at risk
item.description: Outside the only abortion clinic in the border city of McAllen, Texas, a debate has played out for years. Some people pray and beg patients to not go inside as some volunteers escort patients to the entrance. But none of them were there when Rosie Jimenez died just across the street more than 40 years ago.

item.title: Australia's biggest city is starting to live with Covid. Other countries will be watching
'Sense of relief' sweeps across Sydney as Covid lockdown eases
item.description: One major city that is emerging from Covid-19 lockdowns is Sydney. More than five million people have endured a strict lockdown since June, but Australian officials lifted measures after hitting a 70% vaccination rate. CNN's Angus Watson has more.

item.title: ISIS finance chief captured by Iraqi forces, Iraq PM says
item.description: Iraqi forces captured Sami Jasim, the deputy of former ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, Iraq's Prime Minister said in a statement on Monday.

item.title: US Capitol Police whistleblower alleges leadership failures on January 6
item.description: A whistleblower identifying as a former high-ranking US Capitol Police official excoriated the department's leadership before, during and after the deadly January 6 insurrection in a new letter to Congress.

item.title: Nearly 19,000 children crossed the dangerous Darien Gap on foot this year
item.description: A record number of children crossed on foot the treacherous stretch of jungle between Colombia and Panama known as the Darien Gap this year: 19,000, half of whom were under 5 years old, according to UNICEF.

item.title: Climate crisis is 'single biggest health threat facing humanity,' WHO says
Lava from La Palma volcano sparks cement factory fire, pushing 2,500 people into lockdown
item.description: Lava flowing from the Cumbre Vieja volcano on Spain's La Palma island sparked a fire at a cement factory Monday, leading to at least 2,500 residents to be ordered into lockdown to protect their health, a local official said.

item.title: 'It's evil': CNN's Jim Acosta reacts to Trump's remark during interview
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta discusses the chaos around masks in schools and other coronavirus restrictions, and some Republicans who are supporting the apparent bullies in these instances.

item.title: Death of a 15-year-old girl while giving birth exposes dark practice of child marriage in Zimbabwe
item.description: Faith and her other teenage friends sit outside in the bright sun while waiting for their Taekwondo session to start in Epworth, a township southeast of central Harare.

item.title: Video shows US police officers dragging Black paraplegic man out of car during traffic stop
item.description: A Black paraplegic man from Ohio has filed a complaint with the NAACP after video showed police officers pulling him out of his car by his hair and arms during a traffic stop late last month.

item.title: 'We felt the danger': Syria hit hard by Delta variant
item.description: CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports as Idlib province in northwest Syria is ravaged by a Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Gas prices skyrocket as the global energy crisis gets worse
item.description: The cost of energy was dirt cheap in the spring of 2020 as roads and airports sat nearly empty during the height of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Energy crisis could force more UK factories to close
item.description: British companies that produce steel, paper, glass, cement, ceramics and chemicals say they will be forced to close factories or pass on rising costs to consumers unless the UK government provides relief from soaring energy prices.

item.title: Republican triumph in Virginia could further weaken Biden
item.description: Virginia Democrat Terry McAuliffe has admitted President Joe Biden's political woes drag on his gubernatorial campaign. But they pale against the shockwaves that would rip through the White House if he loses his race next month at a perilous time for the party in Washington.

item.title: London police taking 'no further action' over Prince Andrew review
item.description: London's police force has decided to take "no further action" against Prince Andrew, the Duke of York, following a review sparked by Virginia Roberts Giuffre, who has filed a lawsuit against him in New York for alleged sexual abuse.

item.title: Economics Nobel rewards research that showed minimum wage didn't cut jobs
item.description: David Card, Joshua Angrist and Guido Imbens have been awarded the 2021 Nobel Prize in economic sciences for contributions to labor economics and analysis of causal relationships, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced on Monday.

item.title: Trial over murder of 'Africa's Che Guevara' opens in Burkina Faso
item.description: The trial of 14 people accused of plotting to assassinate Burkina Faso's former president Thomas Sankara started on Monday, more than 30 years after he was gunned down in one of the most infamous killings in modern African history.

item.title: Biden's balancing act on Taiwan and China tension
item.description: CNN's Will Ripley looks at the current state of tensions between China and Taiwan, and where the United States fits in.

item.title: Goldman Sachs gets even gloomier on the US economy
item.description: Goldman Sachs is becoming increasingly pessimistic about the US economy as coronavirus support from the government phases out and consumer spending remains on an uncertain path.

item.title: Elon Musk trolls Jeff Bezos as he pulls away as richest person on Earth
item.description: Elon Musk's personal wealth is now $222 billion, widening his gap as the richest person in the world according to Bloomberg's Billionaires Index. Musk's personal wealth skyrocketed an extra $10.6 billion after a secondary share sale by investors, announced last week, valued the space company over $100 billion, CNBC reported.

item.title: Czech President's condition 'stable' after post-election hospitalization
item.description: Czech President Miloš Zeman was in intensive care on Sunday, shortly after holding talks with the country's populist prime minister whose leadership hangs in the balance following a dramatic election.

item.title: China celebrates growth in wealth, power -- and height
item.description: Last week, as China celebrated the 72nd anniversary of Communist Party rule with a week-long public holiday, state-run media cranked up the patriotism to hail the country's economic rise, military achievements, political clout -- and even the height of its men.

item.title: CNN panel reacts to Bill Maher's bleak 2024 election prediction
item.description: CNN panelists Alice Stewart and April Ryan discuss comedian Bill Maher's provocative election prediction.

item.title: Paul McCartney says it was John Lennon who broke up the Beatles
item.description: When the biggest band in British musical history, the Beatles, broke up in 1970, fans pointed the finger at co-lead vocalist Paul McCartney.

item.title: Huntington Beach reopening after oil spill shut it down last week
item.description: Huntington Beach will reopen its shoreline this morning after water testing results came back with non-detectable amounts of oil associated toxins in ocean water, city officials and California State Parks announced.

item.title: Chinese coal prices hit record high and power cuts continue
item.description: Flooding in northern China is hitting a major coal production center hard, sending coal prices soaring and complicating efforts by Beijing to tackle ongoing power shortages.

item.title: Russian performer killed in accident on stage during opera
item.description: A performer at Moscow's renowned Bolshoi Theatre was killed in an accident on stage during an opera. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

item.title: The first IRONMAN with Down syndrome turns his winning moment into a growing movement for inclusion
item.description: Chris Nikic's journey to becoming an elite athlete began with a single step. What kept him going was a single recipe for success: get "1 percent better" every day.

item.title: River of volcanic lava engulfs home
item.description: Buildings near the volcano on the Spanish island of La Palma were engulfed by rivers of lava. Reuters captured video of one home surrounded by lava.

item.title: Timothée Chalamet shares first pictures of his Willy Wonka transformation
item.description: Timothée Chalamet has teased a first look at his portrayal of iconic candy man Willy Wonka in the upcoming film "Wonka."

item.title: George Clooney compares Biden's struggles to 'battered child' after Trump
item.description: In a BBC interview, George Clooney recalls knowing Donald Trump before his presidency. Chief media adviser to George W. Bush and John McCain campaigns Mark McKinnon reacts to the actor's account.

item.title: Nedumudi Venu, acclaimed Indian film actor, dies aged 73
item.description: Indian film star Nedumudi Venu has died at the age of 73, the doctor treating him has confirmed.

item.title: Granville Adams, 'Oz' actor, has died
item.description: Granville Adams, who starred as Zahir Arif on HBO's "Oz," has died following a lengthy battle with cancer, according to a statement shared by his family.

item.title: Hear from William Shatner and crew ahead of Blue Origin space flight
item.description: William Shatner, Audrey Powers, Chris Boshuizen and Glen de Vries speak with CNN's Erica Hill about their upcoming suborbital flight onboard a New Shepard spacecraft.

item.title: Hidden Picasso nude revealed and brought to life with artificial intelligence
item.description: A nude portrait of a crouching woman, hidden beneath the surface of a Pablo Picasso painting, has been revealed using artificial intelligence, advanced imaging technology and 3D printing.

item.title: Jesy Nelson responds to charges of Blackfishing after debut video release
item.description: Jesy Nelson is addressing accusations of Blackfishing and cultural appropriation leveled against her following the release of her new music video on Friday.

item.title: Flight attendants trade heels for sneakers on Ukraine's SkyUp Airlines
item.description: Alexandrina Denysenko, a senior flight attendant with seven years of experience, says she sometimes does not get a spare minute to sit down during a flight and dreams of resting her swollen legs after spending hours wearing heels.

item.title: Man builds rotating house so his wife has better views
item.description: Vojin Kusic from Srbac in Bosnia-Herzegovina says his wife was undecided about the view she wanted to see from their window, so he came up with a solution - a rotating house.

item.title: The traveler who's spent the entire pandemic backpacking
item.description: After working in a corporate job for a number of years, budding photographer Tomas Hromjak decided it was finally the right time to take the year-long backpacking trip he'd been planning for years.

item.title: Adele on Instagram Live was everything
item.description: Adele didn't really know what she was doing on Instagram Live, but it was both charming and revelatory.

item.title: The surreal beauty of Earth's northernmost buildings
item.description: The Arctic invites images of emptiness. Harsh temperatures lead to barren, sparsely populated landscapes beyond the reach of most travelers. This inaccessibility is what first drew Austrian photographer Gregor Sailer to the region.

item.title: Tennis star pledges to donate $50,000 prize money to World Mental Health Day
item.description: Tennis star Iga Swiatek says she will be donating $50,000 of her prize money in support of World Mental Health Day, after progressing to the last 16 of the BNP Paribas Open at Indian Wells on Sunday.

item.title: France wins Nations League as VAR decision leaves Spain fuming
item.description: France came from behind to defeat Spain and claim the UEFA Nations League on Sunday thanks to goals from Karim Benzema and Kylian Mbappé.

item.title: Madonna flashes audience on 'The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon'
item.description: The pop icon was on Fallon's show promoting her new documentary "Madame X" when she decided to make some "good trouble."

item.title: Neymar says the 2022 World Cup could be his last
item.description: Brazilian footballer Neymar has said that he thinks next year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar could be his last.

item.title: Ko Jin-young equals golfing history with dominant Founders Cup win
item.description: In 2019, Ko Jin-young broke a golf legend's record, and on Sunday, she matched another legend's record in her dominant Founders Cup victory.

item.title: Cincinnati Bengals kicker Evan McPherson celebrates game-winning overtime kick. But he actually missed
item.description: Cincinnati Bengals kicker Evan McPherson had a moment to forget on Sunday during his team's thrilling clash with the Green Bay Packers.

item.title: Religious police in the country have been instructed to be more moderate. But away from public view, not every Taliban fighter is following orders.
item.description: The blood-stained bodies of the four accused kidnappers were hung off construction cranes with heavy chains, one with a warning sign strung around his neck, "Abductors will be punished like this."
